title: COVID-19 Vaccine Equity - 20 Communities Initiative
description: Resources for the 20 cities and towns most heavily impacted by COVID-19 pandemic.
cleaned_text: Official websites use .mass.gov A .mass.gov website belongs to an official government organization in Massachusetts. Secure websites use HTTPS certificate A lock icon ( ) or https:// means you've safely connected to the official website. Share sensitive information only on official, secure websites. Top-requested sites to log in to services provided by the state Massachusetts is investing resources to reach priority populations statewide, with a focus on 20 cities and towns most heavily impacted by COVID-19. The goal is to reduce barriers to COVID vaccination, increase awareness of the vaccine's safety and efficacy and, ultimately, increase vaccinations. View DPH's plan to support COVID-19 vaccine equity in Massachusetts. Resources for the 20 communities: Boston, Brockton, Chelsea, Everett, Fall River, Fitchburg, Framingham, Haverhill, Holyoke, Lawrence, Leominster, Lowell, Lynn, Malden, Methuen, New Bedford, Randolph, Revere, Springfield, and Worcester. Resources are available to support and strengthen each community's vaccination efforts. These resources fall broadly under three categories: communications, community outreach and engagement, and vaccine access and navigation.
